lines.text: I'll honor your tradition. I'll go to the Headmaster and I'll lie.
Okay, I'll admit it, you know. I'm an anti-Semite. I crack Jew jokes, think they're dirty, pushy. And you know what? David Greene's the only one I've ever met up close.
What's you're point, Connors?
He's a good guy.
[last lines]
You know something? I'm still gonna get into Harvard. And in 10 years no one will remember any of this. But you'll still be a goddamn Jew.
And you'll still be a prick.
I'd like to forget this whole thing ever happened.

No sir. You're never going to forget this happened, because I'm going to stay here. And every time you see me, you'll remember that it happened. You used me for football. I'll use you to get into Harvard.

[Standing in the rain outside of Iselin Hall]
COWARDS!

True story, last weekend there was a religious revival at Madison Square Garden. Bishop Fulton Sheen made such a stirring speech that 10,000 people converted to Catholicism. Then Billy Graham got up and did some inspired preaching and 10,000 people converted to Protestantism, then to close the program, Pat Boone got up and sang "There's A Gold Mine In The Sky" and 20,000 Jews joined the Air Force!
Was it worth it? Breaking a tradition just to win a football game?
Your tradition or mine, sir?
If I don't get total tit tonight, I will be using this razor to cut my throat. As I see it, sex is my only reason for living.
Then be careful you don't cut your hand.
You lied to me!
I didn't lie to you! I lied to my father! I lied to myself!

Be seated, gentlemen. It appears that someone in this class cheated on yesterday's history exam. Today is Saturday. Your next class is on Monday. Therefore, we are faced with a rather bleak situation. If the guilty party does not come forward, or is not identified by then, I shall be forced to fail the entire section.
Isn't that unfair, sir? Only one of us cheated.
We have all been dishonored by this person and I will not tolerate it.
How can you be sure that someone cheated, sir?
I would prefer to keep the evidence to myself for the time being.
Can't you just throw out the old test and give us a new one?
And pretend that no one cheated? But someone did cheat. Whoever did this has robbed you of your honor. If I ignore it, he will have robbed me of mine as well. I leave it in your hands, gentlemen.
You never told me what religion you are.
I'm a Methodist.
A Methodist. And all this time I didn't know it.

[pretending to sneeze as David walks by]
A-Jew!
Everybody's asking me what it's like to kiss a Jew.
I have a confession to make, I think about you more than I ought to.
...and the meek shall inherit the earth.
I wonder how meek they'll be when they do, sir.
You people are very... determined, aren't you?
Sometimes we have to be, sir.
The cultural environment in which one lives ought to be as important as the air he breathes... the food he eats.
The honor code is a living thing. It cannot exist in a vacuum.
[first lines]
Davey! Davey you're here.
[big hug]
He's not going off to war, only Massachusetts, huh?
The weed of crime bears bitter fruit. Crime does not pay. The Shadow knows.
